      • process

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage process(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image0,
                                                   java.awt.image.BufferedImage image1,
                                                   java.lang.Boolean dualCamera)
        Method for processing Images, is called from VideoListener and processes every Image on imageUpdated. Takes care of Generating an OpenCV-Mat and calls processMat.
        Parameters:
        image0 - left Camera Image = BufferedImage
        image1 - right Camera Image = BufferedImage
        Returns:
        = BufferedImage

      • processMat

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage processMat(org.opencv.core.Mat imageMat0,
                                                      org.opencv.core.Mat imageMat1,
                                                      java.lang.Boolean dualCamera)
        Main Method for processing Images, is called from VideoListener and processes every Image on imageUpdated. Takes care of processing the image and transforming back to BufferdImage.
        Parameters:
        imageMat0 - = Mat - left Camera Image
        imageMat1 - = Mat - right Camera Image
        dualCamera -
        Returns:

      • put

        private static void put(org.opencv.core.Mat image,
                        java.lang.String text,
                        org.opencv.core.Point point,
                        org.opencv.core.Scalar Color)
        Wrapper for putText-Method of OpenCV, because some parameters don't change.
        Parameters:
        image - = Image, the text should be displayed on
        text - = Text to be written
        point - = Point, were Text should be displayed
        Color - = the Color in which the the Text is displayed

      • drawCenterWithRollAt

        private static void drawCenterWithRollAt(org.opencv.core.Mat imageMat,
                                         org.opencv.core.Point center,
                                         int circleRadius,
                                         int lineLength)
        The Center for Orientation with extra line displaying the Rotation of the Head along the roll axis
        Parameters:
        imageMat - = Image
        center - = Centerpoint of Orientationcenter
        circleRadius - = Radius of Circle
        lineLength - = length of the line which is drawn to display rotation

      • drawHorizonWithRollAt

        private static void drawHorizonWithRollAt(org.opencv.core.Mat imageMat,
                                          org.opencv.core.Point center,
                                          int circleRadius,
                                          int lineLength)
        Alternativ Test for static Horizon, the roll axis could be displayed there, too. But I checked, if this could work and it looked awful. A TODO: Display Roll of Drone, this could look nice.
        Parameters:
        imageMat - = Image
        center - = CenterPoint of Horizon
        circleRadius - = Radius of HorizonCircle
        lineLength - = length of the lines drawn left and right of the HorizonCircle
